title: 115_hr4798
content: The Act titled "Inventory of Assets for Communications Facilities Act of 2018" requires an inventory of federal assets. The Act mandates the Administrator of General Services to ensure the database includes an inventory of covered assets within a year. This inventory must be made available to entities involved in communications facilities or services. Executive agencies are required to provide information within nine months. The Act mandates Executive agencies to provide information on covered assets to the Administrator within nine months of enactment. Information includes asset location, type (e.g., building, land, utility pole), and contact details of an officer or employee. The Act requires Executive agencies to provide updated information on covered assets, including contact details for an agency officer, whether the asset is historic property, and any other relevant information deemed appropriate by the Administrator. If there are any changes to the information provided, the agency head must update the Administrator within 30 days. The Act mandates Executive agencies to update information on covered assets, including acquisition details within 30 days. Classified information can be excluded for national security reasons. The agency, in consultation with the Administrator, can exclude information about a covered asset from the inventory if it would harm national security. Classified information is defined as data requiring protection for national security reasons. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 defines restricted data. State and local governments can voluntarily provide information on assets for inclusion in the inventory. The Administrator will include this information in the inventory in the same manner as information from Executive agencies. State and local governments must provide updated information on assets to the Administrator within 30 days of any changes. Failure to comply will result in denial of access to the inventory. The Administrator will update the inventory with information from State and local governments within 7 days of receiving it. The Administrator must receive updated information on assets from State and local governments within 30 days of any changes. The inventory must include the most recent date of information addition or update for each asset. Location information in the inventory should be in Geographic Information System format. Measures will be adopted to prevent unauthorized access to the inventory. Definitions for "Administrator" and "Assistant Secretary" are provided. The term "Assistant Secretary" refers to the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information. A "communications facility" includes wireless or wireline infrastructure for transmitting various forms of data, equipment, antennas designed for emitting radio frequency, and more. The term "communications service" refers to a service for transmitting various forms of data. A "covered asset" is any Federal real property that could accommodate a broadband communications facility. The term "Executive agency" is defined as per section 105 of title 5, United States Code. It refers to an entity that constructs or operates broadband communications facilities or provides broadband communications services suitable for deployment.
